abstract: Many Republican freshmen in Congress are advocating that the immigration policy be changed in small, bite-size pieces rather than demand sweeping changes in legislation, in an effort to redefine the party's increasingly anti-immigration image.
snippet: Many freshmen in Congress now support bite-size policy changes rather than a total overhaul, in an effort to redefine the party’s increasingly anti-immigration image.
lead_paragraph: Many freshmen in Congress now support bite-size policy changes rather than a total overhaul, in an effort to redefine the party’s increasingly anti-immigration image.

headline.main: Beyond 2012 Field, Nuanced G.O.P. Views on Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Some Republicans in Congress Are Pushing Steps to Ease Immigration
